tool.name: process sff
tool.description: Convert sff to FASTA and QUAL files
tool.command:
uncompress_tgz.py -i $input_dir -o process_sff_input; process_sff.py -i process_sff_input #if $no_trim: --no_trim #end if
#if $make_flowgram: -f #end if
#if $convert_to_FLX: -t #end if
#if $use_sfftools: --use_sfftools #end if -o process_sff_output; compress_path.py -i process_sff_output -o $output_dir

param.label: -i/--input_dir: Input directory of sff files or a single sff filepath
param.name: input_dir

param.label: --no_trim: do not trim sequence/qual (requires --use_sfftools option) [default: False]
param.name: no_trim

param.label: -t/--convert_to_FLX: convert Titanium reads to FLX length. [default: False]
param.name: convert_to_FLX

param.label: --use_sfftools: use the external programs sfffile and sffinfo for processing, instead of the equivalent python implementation
param.name: use_sfftools

tool.help:
This script converts a directory of sff files into FASTA, QUAL and flowgram files.
This script results in FASTA and QUAL formatted files.
